Characteristics of Naïve Bayes Classifiers
4. They are robust to isolated noise points
– Because such points can’t significantly impact the probability estimates
• P(x1|y), P(x2|y), …, P(xd|y)
5. They can handle missing values in the training and test sets
– Training set: ignore the missing values while computing P(xi|y) 
– Test set: use only the non-missing attribute values
• 𝑃 𝑦 x1, x2, …, xd ≈ 𝑃(𝑦) ∙ 𝑝 𝑥1 𝑦 ∙ 𝑝 𝑥2 𝑦 ∙ ⋯ ∙ 𝑝 𝑥𝑑 𝑦
6. They are robust to irrelevant attribute
– If Xi is an irrelevant attribute, then P(xi|y) becomes almost uniformly 
distributed for every class y, resulting in negligible impact
